properties.name: frontend.app.host
properties.description: Host URL of the frontend application.

properties.name: jwt.secret
properties.description: Secret key to sign and then validate JWT tokens.

properties.name: jwt.expiration.ms
properties.description: How long the JWT should be valid for (in milliseconds).

properties.name: jwt.refresh.expiration.ms
properties.description: How long the Refresh Token, also a JWT, should be valid for (in milliseconds).

properties.name: jwt.refresh.token.cookie.max.age
properties.description: How long the Cookie containing the Refresh Token should be valid for (in milliseconds). Should be same as jwt.refresh.expiration.ms.

properties.name: authorization.token.header.value.prefix
properties.description: Prefix for the Authorization token header value, e.g. 'Bearer'.

properties.name: jwt.refresh.token.cookie.http.only
properties.description: Whether the Refresh Token Cookie should be secure or not, i.e., https only.

properties.name: jwt.refresh.token.cookie.domain
properties.description: Domain for the Refresh Token Cookie, if omitted, the Cookie will be set to 'host-only'.

properties.name: spring.modulith.events.jdbc-schema-initialization.enabled
properties.description: The JDBC-based event publication registry support expects the following database schemas to be present in the database. If you would like Spring Modulith to create the schema for you, set the application property.
